intro: Oxystigma gilbertii, commonly known as the Gilbert's oxystigma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Oxystigma gilbertii is often found in areas with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
